This pixel-styled platformer has all the qualities of a great game. Running thought the town beating up baddies, but after every save you have to watch and ad. It gets annoying after awhile, but you can turn on airplane mode in settings to avoid this. Another thing is that after every level you have to wait 24 hours to unlock the next level, unless you want to sit through more ads.

title.label: Very good retro game, dev team obviously knows how to do this style of art well.

content.label:
9/10!!!  VERY GOOD IN (almost) ALL ASPECTS!
Let me start this review with the most positive things about this game. It has many many hours of content, from the main story, to hard mode, to adventure mode, to maxing out all the characters. The pixel art is godlike, without overshading or being too complicated. Animations and cutscenes manage to be smooth regardless of the general choppiness of pixel stylization. The monetization is a good amount, very very few ads and not forcing you to purchase in-game currency. Enemy and player difficulty scaling is quite good, with the end levels matching your power through upgrades by the time you get to that point. 

Now for the few shortcomings this game has. 
Firstly, if you purchase barry at the beginning of the game, none of the levels until the final world will be of any difficulty. He is too overpowered to be able to use at the beginning of the game, perhaps you could unlock him after the first boss, and have a lower upgrade cap. Secondly, the custom character clothing makes ZERO sense. By taking 15 mins to play some adventure mode, you can get clothed that are only 5% worse than the best in the game? Why would this make sense at all?! The whole point of having the super expensive maxed gear is so people will pay irl money to get the coins, but after a 15 min grind you can get something almost as good? Thirdly, the story is very very confusing. There is basically no context, and no real way to tell who we’re rooting for. Especially since (SPOILER WARNING) the final boss is one of the red guys who seemed to be on our team the whole time? Fourthly, there are quite a few bugs relating to combat. One of them lets enemies hit you right through a combo, another made the bullets one of the enemies shot stay on screen and leave behind the old frames (leaving white lines across my screen until i reloaded the game) and another one resulting in the dog boss being unkillable. Lastly, the miscellaneous ones. The second-to-final boss doesn't make sense, and feels like the dev team changed lanes 3/4 of the way through making the game. The tokens system is confusing, getting every character maxed takes wayyy too long and there isnt a 100% completion reward (that im aware of, i probably am missing one star in a random level) and the prices for the upgrades (weapons included) are ridiculous compared to what you get out of it. 

In the end, its an amazing game, but could be soooo much better with just a little bit of polishing. 

Eagerly awaiting the next update,
A dedicated gamer.

PS. I think we all want to have non-coop multiplayer, maybe you can search by level of player and reduce the stun time/add a bigger health bar.

Another problem is the custom character I have been stuck with the shark costume for a really long time and a lot of people I play with all wear the shark skin. I think you should make some skins free. Other than that the game is pretty good

Man, I just got this game late last night and I’m already enjoying it. It’s a mixture of a kid-friendly, old school, action packed video game enjoyable for all ages young and old. I love the bosses and the fighting styles and how they don’t throw you into a difficult situation if you don’t want to be. This  mobile game is acceptable when it comes to being a ninja game. I am addicted to this game and I think the creators did an excellent job on this game and I hope to see many more video games from them in the future. Thanks for making this game guys!
